sentence.Network_en: Every inn had a picturesque name — the Black Locust Inn, the Blueberry Inn.
sentence.Network_cn: 每个旅馆都有一个别致的名字，如“洋槐树旅馆”、“蓝莓旅馆”。

sentence.Network_en: I'll be back before you can say blueberry pie.
sentence.Network_cn: 你蓝莓馅饼几个字还没说完我就会回来了.

sentence.Network_en: When we got home, my mother decided to make a blueberry pie.
sentence.Network_cn: 回家后, 母亲决定做一个紫浆果派.

entry.tran: （产于北美的）蓝莓，越橘蓝色浆果
entry.def: A blueberry is a small dark blue fruit that is found in North America. Blueberries are usually cooked before they are eaten.

means.word_mean: 1. any of numerous shrubs of the genus Vaccinium bearing blueberries
2. sweet edible dark-blue berries of either low-growing or high-growing blueberry plants
